bib_record.title: Fast-neutron cross sections of elemental bismuth.

free_txt: Protons on lithium-7
Pulsed beam time of flight
Approved by A.B.Smith, 80/5/28.
Data reeived from A.B.Smith, 12/1979
Statistical accuracy of measured values,
1-3%. Systematic uncertainties are less.
Elemental carbon total cross sections measured
concurrently to test for measurement system fidelity.
Right circular cylinder of elemental bismuth.
Diameter of 2.5-cm, transmission thickness of 2-cm.
Diameter of 2.5-cm, transmission thickness of 4-cm.
Corrected for perturbations due to beam attenuation,
multiple events, and angular resolution of apparatus.
Hydrogenous detectors
Measurements made under varied conditions
over period of years. Neutron resolution varies from
20-50 keV, uncertainties in cross sections varies
from 5-10%. Relative scattering angles known to
+-0.5 degrees, absolute angle determined to within
approximately 1-degree.
ANL fast neutron generator
The same data point is typed twice in author's
printout.
160 deg data points are typed before 154 deg data
point in in author's printout.
Carbon scattering cross sections measured concurrently
to verify performance of measurement system. Sample
placed so that neutron beam is incident on lateral
surface.
Measured cross sections
determined relative to hydrogen elastic cross
sections.
Spontaneous fission of Cf-252 used to determine
relative sensitivities of neutron detectors
Cylinder 2-cm in diameter, 2-cm long
